intro: Chamaesyce barbicarina, commonly known as the barbed sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are usually hairy and have a distinctive barbed appearance, which gives it its scientific name. Chamaesyce barbicarina is often found in open habitats such as deserts, grasslands, and along roadsides.
